title: Yasuo's balance/brokeness
body:
I don't think his kit is broken. His Q,W,E in my opinion are finre. It creates outplay and a fun champ. Especially his Wind wall, I don't find it broken since you have to wait it out like a Kayle ultimate or taric Ultimate.

But i do think they could do something about his passive and damage scalings without changing the champion. To me it's out the ass. Keep same mechanics, change the damage in a certain way or something

What do you guys think?

replies.body: what makes yasuo hard to deal with is the Armor pen from his ult. If you remove that Yasuo would be ridiculously weak. But hey, thats a good starting point. Then they can figure out how to make it a bit better

nothing wrong with his passive, its just a very single target midgame power spike that falls off later.

his primary damage source (crits) is literally designed to fall off lategame.

"but muh double crit chance"

He gets double crit chance meaning he power spikes twice as fast

but he also gets 10% less critical strike damage meaning that as the end game approaches he will be dealing less if he builds crit whenever he crits. 

"but muh mobility!" 

its a fixed distance therefore the faster the average champ is moving the less it matters
additionally cdr and how much damage is being dealt to him in a short amount of time matter as well

"but muh shield" 

doesn't scale that well unless you are 100% dependent on some incredibly weak poke 

"but muh ult"

yasuo can zone you like a mage or most midlaners, just act like youre playing against veigar who also falls off lategame.

Did you just say crit is designed to fall off late? Did you just say VEIGAR falls off late? 

I don't think I need to say anything here.

But I will say this: Yasuo's dash may be a fixed distance, but it's not a fixed speed; its speed scales with his movement speed and thus your argument there doesn't work either.

(Edited by moderation)
Or, you know, he actually uses windwall on the projectile instead of you using the projectile on the windwall.
or you know, I've said to now waste all of your skills on it once he blocks one and play around a 24 seconds cooldown.

Do you know how his Windwall works?

Even if a projectile makes contact with Yasuo, his Windwall can still block it because it comes from behind him.

There's none of this "noob throwing spells into the windwall", it's "yasuo just blocked my ult and there's nothing that could've been done about it other than _hoping beyond all hope_ that he wastes it instead."

If Yasuo saves his windwall specifically for you ult, then he's fucking eating free poke. Jesus christ, you make it sound like you should be able to faceroll onto someone and if doesn't work, then the champion must be fucking broken.

His passive is what eats the poke, not his Windwall.

And you make it sound like Yasuo is just standing there taking punishment when he in fact could be putting his sword up your ass.

Yasuo's Q is an empowered auto (full ad scaling) his is like 30%, and his ult is only 150% bonus ad. With the crit rebuff on his Q, an entire rotation only deals damage equivalent to like 3 autos come late game.
But he does 3 autos in one rotation which barely takes a second or two, and his Q and E both have extremely low CDs lategame.

which seems to half health tanks alike.
3 autos in 1 spell is a lot
I simply think he's obnoxious to play against but he's not broken.

I'd say change his crit scaling per level. So say he has {{item:1051}} at level 1. He'd stay at 10% crit chance. And if he kept that item or another item depending on how much crit damage it would eventually scale into the full 100% with {{item:3046}} and{{item:3031}} .
